title: (x) book covers by Hyperkit - Kursivschrift/Clarendon {Yves}
content:
[http://www.hyperkit.co.uk/docs/home.php?id=4:0:0:0:4](http://web.archive.org/web/20060529195108/http:/www.hyperkit.co.uk/docs/home.php?id=4:0:0:0:4)

[http://www.hyperkit.co.uk/docs/home.php?id=4:0:0:0:24](http://web.archive.org/web/20060529195108/http:/www.hyperkit.co.uk/docs/home.php?id=4:0:0:0:24)

What is the fonts used on the covers of these books?

Thanks
author: NoDesign

comments.content:
We’ve had this specific request before: it’s [Kursivschrift](http://web.archive.org/web/20060529195108/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=LH.101096.0.0).

_Lovely…_

The second one is [Clarendon](http://web.archive.org/web/20060529195108/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=LH.8250.0.0), but you might want to check out [Stefan Hattenbach](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Stefan%20Hattenbach)’s [Oxtail](http://web.archive.org/web/20060529195108/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_oxtail.html) over at [Psy/Ops](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Psy/Ops).
